Title: Directs the superintendent of state police to develop and institute arrest policies and procedures when the arrested individual has responsibility for a person with an intellectual or developmental disability
Summary: Directs the superintendent of state police to develop and institute arrest policies and procedures for instances where police are arresting an individual who has responsibility for a person with an intellectual or developmental disability.
ActClause: AN ACT to amend the executive law and the criminal procedure law, in relation to directing the superintendent of state police to develop and institute arrest policies and procedures for instances where police are arresting an individual who is a parent, guardian or other person legally charged with the care or custody of a person with an intellectual or developmental disability
